Sheet1.Question: I’ve never run a fundraiser before — is it hard?
Sheet1.Answer: Not at all! We make it simple with step-by-step guidance, easy-to-use tools, and full support from start to finish.

Sheet1.Question: How do I get started?
Sheet1.Answer: You can schedule your fundraiser directly on our website or by speaking with a fundraising specialist. We’ll walk you through selecting the best fundraiser, setting your timeline, and getting your group ready.

Sheet1.Question: Which fundraiser do you recommend?
Sheet1.Answer: All of our fundraisers are proven to be successful. It really is up to you which product you would like to run. If you run more than one fundraiser each year, you may want to mix it up by offering a different product each time. Maybe Butter Braids in the fall and winter for the holiday season and Cookie Dough in the Spring and Summer as a great year round treat.

Sheet1.Question: Do we need to schedule a kickoff meeting?
Sheet1.Answer: We highly recommend a quick kickoff meeting to energize your group and explain how everything works. We provide kickoff materials to make this easy.

Sheet1.Question: How long does a fundraiser take?
Sheet1.Answer: Most fundraisers run for 2-3 weeks of active selling, plus a few days for setup and a few days for wrap-up.

Sheet1.Question: How far in advance should we schedule our fundraiser?
Sheet1.Answer: Ideally, schedule your fundraiser 4-6 weeks in advance so we have plenty of time for materials, promotion, and kickoff.

Sheet1.Question: When is the best time of year to run a fundraiser?
Sheet1.Answer:
Anytime works, but the most popular months are:
Fall: August - November
Spring: February - May

Sheet1.Question: Do I have to choose just one product per fundraiser?
Sheet1.Answer: No, you can choose to run both the Butter Braid and Cookie Dough products at the same time if you want. However, many organizations like to split them into two different fundraisers to raise even more money for their groups.

Sheet1.Question: How long can frozen products stay out of the freezer?
Sheet1.Answer: Frozen products are safe at room temperature for several hours during pickup and delivery. We recommend refrigerating or freezing as soon as possible afterward.

Sheet1.Question: How are products delivered?
Sheet1.Answer: Products are delivered directly to your group for distribution. We’ll coordinate the delivery date with you.

Sheet1.Question: Do you offer ship-to-home options?
Sheet1.Answer: Yes! Some of our fundraisers include direct-to-home shipping, making it even easier for friends and family to support your fundraiser from anywhere.

Sheet1.Question: How much money will we make?
Sheet1.Answer: This depends on your group's size and participation. Most groups make between $2,000 - $20,000+.

Sheet1.Question: How many units do people order?
Sheet1.Answer: It varies quite a bit. Some people will order just a single unit, while others will order more than a dozen. On average, we have found that most people will order about 2.5 units.

Sheet1.Question: How many units do I have to sell to reach my fundraising goal?
Sheet1.Answer: It depends on your goal and on the sales mix of the products. You can calculate it by dividing your goal by the profit margin of the product you are selling.

Sheet1.Question: How much of the money do we keep?
Sheet1.Answer: Groups typically keep 40% to 50% of the sales as profit, depending on the fundraiser selected.

Sheet1.Question: Is there a minimum order or group size?
Sheet1.Answer: No minimum order is required, but larger groups with strong participation typically raise more.

Sheet1.Question: Who collects the money?
Sheet1.Answer: For online sales, payments are processed automatically. For in-person orders, money can be collected by group members and submitted as a group total.

Sheet1.Question: What payment methods do you accept?
Sheet1.Answer: We accept online payments by credit card and in-person sales can be paid by cash, check, or card (depending on the fundraiser).

Sheet1.Question: How do we get more people to participate?
Sheet1.Answer:
Here are our top tips:
Hold a fun kickoff meeting.
Set clear goals and prizes.
Share via email, text, and social media.
Involve parents early.
Recognize top sellers weekly.

Sheet1.Question: What participation rate should we expect?
Sheet1.Answer: Most groups see 60%-80% participation with good promotion and kickoff meetings.

Sheet1.Question: Can you help us with promotional materials?
Sheet1.Answer: Absolutely! We provide flyers, social media graphics, email templates, text scripts, and more.

Sheet1.Question: What types of groups do you work with?
Sheet1.Answer:
We work with:
Schools (elementary, middle, high school)
Sports teams
Band and choir groups
Dance teams
Cheerleading teams
Student Organizations and Clubs
Church groups
Youth organizations
Nonprofits

Sheet1.Question: What can we expect during the fundraiser?
Sheet1.Answer: Expect a smooth, simple process with full guidance, ongoing support, promotional tools, and consistent communication.

Sheet1.Question: How much effort does it take?
Sheet1.Answer: We’ve designed everything to be as easy as possible. Most leaders spend just a few hours total for planning and coordination.

Sheet1.Question: Are there order forms?
Sheet1.Answer: Yes — many fundraisers include both paper order forms and online ordering options.

Sheet1.Question: Can people order online?
Sheet1.Answer: Yes! Every group gets a custom online store to make it easy for family and friends to support from anywhere.

Sheet1.Question: When do we receive our fundraising materials?
Sheet1.Answer: We provide all materials (order forms, flyers, online store link, etc.) well before your fundraiser kicks off.

Sheet1.Question: What if we have questions during the fundraiser?
Sheet1.Answer: You’ll have a dedicated Fundraising Coach and 24/7 access to our support team via phone, email, or chat.

Sheet1.Question: Do you offer live support?
Sheet1.Answer: Yes — you can reach a live representative anytime during business hours, and the AI receptionist can handle most questions outside of business hours.

Sheet1.Question: Kickoff?
Sheet1.Answer: Yes, highly recommended. We help run it.

Sheet1.Question: Profit Margin?
Sheet1.Answer: Usually 40%-50%.

Sheet1.Question: Duration?
Sheet1.Answer: About 2-3 weeks.

Sheet1.Question: How much can we raise?
Sheet1.Answer: $2,000 - $20,000 depending on group size & participation.

Sheet1.Question: Frozen Products?
Sheet1.Answer: Some are frozen. Safe for hours out of the freezer.

Sheet1.Question: Who collects money?
Sheet1.Answer: Online is automatic. In-person can collect cash/check.

Sheet1.Question: Payment methods?
Sheet1.Answer: Credit cards, cash, checks, depending on the program.

Sheet1.Question: Marketing help?
Sheet1.Answer: Yes — we provide full promo kits.
